title: Ticket #5369: Intermittent failure in job_core_perhold_local
description:
While testing other things, I see that regression test for job_core_perhold_local failed, complaining that using

periodic_hold = JobStatus == 2

sees two hold messages in the user log, and indeed there are: 

000 (002.000.000) 11/02 23:13:56 Job submitted from host: <127.0.0.1:57712?addrs=127.0.0.1-57712&noUDP&sock=1277_7e87_3>
...
001 (002.000.000) 11/02 23:13:57 Job executing on host: <127.0.0.1:57712?addrs=127.0.0.1-57712&noUDP&sock=2056_634d_2>
...
004 (002.000.000) 11/02 23:14:17 Job was evicted.
    (0) Job was not checkpointed.
        Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Remote Usage
        Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Local Usage
    0  -  Run Bytes Sent By Job
    0  -  Run Bytes Received By Job
...
012 (002.000.000) 11/02 23:14:24 Job was held.
    The job attribute PeriodicHold expression 'JobStatus == 2' evaluated to TRUE
    Code 3 Subcode 0
...
012 (002.000.000) 11/02 23:14:24 Job was held.
    The job attribute PeriodicHold expression 'JobStatus == 2' evaluated to TRUE
    Code 3 Subcode 0
...
009 (002.000.000) 11/02 23:14:26 Job was aborted by the user.
    via condor_rm (by user slot3)

However, I don't think we guarantee exactly one hold message in this case. We should fix the test.
